intro: Tarenna mollissima, commonly known as the velvet tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and clusters of small, white flowers. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Tarenna mollissima thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat.
